sub_title: Accomplished IT Strategist/Visionary, Digital Transformation, Global Energy Industry, BSc in IT Service Management
summary:
As a highly experienced IT Executive I have achieved significant success in leveraging intellectual talent and emerging technologies to lead digital transformation and have influenced internal and external cross-functional teams to adopt new technologies and deliver value to the bottom line.

In my current role I am the Chief Data Officer for HR & Corporate Functions at Shell International in The Hague, Netherlands. Previous experience includes global leadership roles within the Shell Group.

My recent achievements include:

- Built credibility through diverse senior roles in a top-tier global energy leader and leveraged opportunities enabled by new digital technologies with a focus on additive manufacturing, blockchain, big data analytics, IoT, wearables, RPA and robotics.
- Delivered and negotiated data specific terms & conditions for global facility management contracts with contract value over $600M value, to ensure Shell remains strategic control over their data.
- Designed and executed an approach as part of a Global Programme to maximize capital efficiency in ‘Upstream’ capital projects, which achieved cost savings of over $1Bln in 18 months.
- Planned large-scale extensions to production facilities, which included the translation of the IT and data strategy into contracting strategies and execution plans.
- Led the global IT strategy, innovation and end-to-end delivery of IT projects and services for the construction, maintenance and wet stock management for all Retail stations worldwide.
- Developed and executed the Value Delivery Framework, part of a global initiative, for Capital Projects IM/IT that is considered to be a best practice within Shell globally.
- Served as Global Retail IT Manager for Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestments, and led the divestment of Sweden and the creation of the world’s largest biofuels JV in Brazil (Cosan).
- Functioned as Global IT Joint Venture Manager, formulated the IT strategy, and led the delivery of IT projects and services to Retail joint ventures in China and Ukraine.

I hold a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology and have undertaken extensive professional development.

I can be reached via LinkedIn.

profile_positions.description: As the Chief Data Officer, I drive digitalization for the Shell Group through leading data strategy, data governance, data management and data quality to ensure the entire Corporate Centre (including HR, Finance, Legal, Information Risk Management, IT, Real Estate, Health, External Affairs, Security, Travel) has the required data and capabilities to deliver their strategic aspirations. I also advise Executives, Planners, and Strategists on investment and business opportunities and collaborate with business and IT organisations, innovation forums and suppliers to develop digitalization opportunities focused on big data analytics, machine learning and artificial intelligence.

profile_positions.description:
As the Digital Transformation Advisor I drive value for the Shell Group through new and emerging technologies and the application of existing capability. I also advise IT Executives, Planners, and Strategists on investment and business opportunities and collaborate with business and IT organisations, IT innovation forums, suppliers, and academia to develop digitalization opportunities focused on big data analytics, additive manufacturing, blockchain, IoT, wearables and robotics.

My achievements include:

- Promoted collaboration between IT Managers and Senior Business Managers, and delivered digitalization opportunities with a business value of over $200M Net Present Value.
- Set-up of a global, cross-business additive manufacturing programme focussing on 3D printing of spare parts with a business value of over $150M Net Present Value.
- Spearheaded the Disruptive Theme, focused on the identification and evaluation of new emerging technologies such as quantum computing and hashgraph.
- Launched a new Blockchain Theme, supported opportunities for Proof of Concept and built a Community of Interest.
- Transformed a highly dysfunctional team due to absence of a team leader into a high performing team.
- Identified and developed Digital Persons, to demonstrate the advantages of digitalization in the working environment.
- Instituted and implemented the Offshoring Programme to India for the Innovation Department, which included organisational design, the creation of job descriptions, candidate assessments, interviews and on boarding.
- Implemented an innovation funnel management solution covering digitalization opportunities across Shell globally.
- Introduced a Quarterly Appraisal standard for use in senior stakeholder engagements.
profile_positions.title: Digital Transformation Advisor

profile_positions.description:
PT2020 is an intervention programme mandated by the Executive Committee of Shell and is designed to improve capital efficiency and support Shell in powering progress by providing more and cleaner energy solutions. My primary responsibilities entailed the delivery of Information Management (IM) and Information Technology (IT) requirements in the early phases of capital projects for Shell Upstream Operated and JV businesses. CAPEX on these projects typically ranged from $5B to $10B, while IM/IT spend was between1% to 5%.

My achievements included:

- Served as an IM/IT Business Manager and trusted advisor, engaged executive stakeholders, and developed and managed a pre-FID project funnel.
- Developed a process for the creation and management of the Upstream Operated funnel of new capital projects, oversaw multi-year manpower planning, and implemented a structured IT project performance review.
- Led the Operated functional improvement agenda, which included customer satisfaction and the development of success stories.
- Developed and executed the Value Delivery Framework as part of a global IT initiative, which enabled the identification, measurement and reporting of how IT is driving value to the bottom line of the business, and implemented an approach in Capital projects IM/IT that is considered to be a best practice within Shell globally.
- Launched the Upstream Programme Management Office (PMO) created a team, and developed a shared agenda and action plan for the rapid mobilisation of the PT2020 journey in Upstream Operated & Upstream Joint Ventures.
- Designed and deployed the PT2020 Assist Process for the validation of cost reduction opportunities, which was replicated to all other PT2020 work streams and has generated multi-billion dollar UDC savings across Shell.
profile_positions.title: Global IT Delivery Manager / PT2020 Upstream Engine PMO - Capital Projects Upstream

profile_positions.description:
In this role I was accountable for oversight of the global delivery of Retail IT services for Engineering, HSSE and Soil & Ground Water. 

My achievements included:

- Directed a global IT portfolio in which business execution was outsourced to third parties, engaged extensively on the IT strategy, opportunities and projects and ensured alignment with internal and external business partners.
- Re-established the broken relationship between Engineering and IT, established a single digital repository for all Engineering Documents related to all Shell retail stations globally.
- Developed the Site Automation Roadmap outlining the approach of migrating the Site Systems to the cloud. 
- Developed facility management and integrated support strategies and unified Engineering and IT standards and equipment testing on site.
- Implemented a pilot in Norway, where on-site IT and Engineering support activities were managed across external business partners, and achieved a step-change in site uptime, which was replicated to 5 major markets in 2014.
- Delivered Building Management Systems (Smart Retail) from ideation to approved business case and implementation.
- Instituted Intuitive Refuelling, which was piloted at 200 sites to enable the future customer experience and the delivery of real-time messaging through a customer screen on the forecourt / shop.
- Launched a global leak detection analytics solution for the identification of potential wet stock losses at fuel stations.
profile_positions.title: Global IT Manager Retail Engineering, HSSE & Environmental Services

profile_positions.description:
I directed the delivery of Retail IT requirements for Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestments and oversaw IT delivery to the Retail joint ventures in China (JV not operated by Shell) and Ukraine (JV operated by Shell).

My achievements included:

- Oversaw a confidential global portfolio with limited access to Subject Matter Experts and decision makers, created a highly engaged global Retail IT Extended Leadership Team and ensured that buyers could operate on Day 1.
- Realised an HSSE step-change by focusing on stress awareness in order to avoid unsafe and unhealthy situations.
- Spearheaded the divestment of Sweden, Finland, France, Gibraltar, Hawaii, Panama, Costa Rica, Dominican Republic and Chile.
- Established the Cosan joint venture in Brazil, led acquisitions of Edeka in Germany and Total UK and implemented an Alliance in Switzerland.
- Formulated a global retail IT joint venture strategy, global retail IT Alliance strategy, and co-authored the China IT strategy. 
- Contributed significantly to the global Retail IT Strategy and global Innovation Programme.
profile_positions.title: Global IT Manager Retail Strategy & Portfolio

profile_positions.description:
In this position, I identified opportunities for innovation, developed an in-depth understanding of IT architecture roadmaps and external IT developments, venture capital movements, university research, government funding, disruptive trends and R&D. I secured Executive Sponsors and won support for the business case, which was handed over to a Programme Manager for execution.

My achievements included:

- Deployed a Shell-wide Green IT Programme and Energy Challenge @ Work Programme through partnerships between IT, Real Estate and Procurement divisions across Shell.
- Developed new opportunities in Seismic sensing, Future Office, Serious Gaming, Virtual Collaboration environments, BotNets and Electric Mobility.
- Spearheaded Global IT portfolio reviews on the identification of innovation opportunities outside of strategic roadmaps.
- Built a network of groups which included Shell IT, the Shell Chief Technology Officers network, Shell Strategy and Shell GameChanger and launched an Innovation Opportunity Realisation Programme with large IT suppliers.
- Delivered presentations at internal conferences and launched a monthly cartoon series to teach Shell staff about the benefits of digital transformation.
profile_positions.title: Global Senior Advisor Technology Investigations

profile_positions.description:
Oversaw the implementation of Sarbanes Oxley (SOX 404) requirements for IT General Controls (C11, C12, C13) and Application Embedded Controls (System Controls & IT Dependent Controls) covering Shell Nederland Verkoopmaatschappij and 4 subsidiaries, Shell Nederland Raffinaderij (Pernis) and the pan-European Cards business. The SOX programme was high profile and was driven by the Shell Board of Directors following the Shell “reserve crisis” and involved 3,000 controls. Managed a number of senior stakeholders, as well as nine direct reports that were all Senior Consultants /Partners from Ernst & Young. Oversaw risk and issue management for the entire programme.

My achievements included:

- Assessed and remediated over 3,000 non-compliant IT controls, through the design and execution of new standardized processes.
- Supported the Programme Manager in the development of proposals, briefings and other engagement material for key stakeholders as well as for the team. 
- Optimised the SOX OP IT Europe team by recommending smarter ways of working.
- Supported the SOX OP IT Europe Programme Manager and managed the Programme and 85-member team spread across Europe during their absence over and above regular responsibilities.
profile_positions.title: SOX IT Project Manager Netherlands
